intro: Streptocarpus trabeculatus, commonly known as the rock streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Streptocarpus trabeculatus thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. It is often grown as a decorative houseplant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
